newsitem.title: USA: California Water sets stock split.
newsitem.headline: California Water sets stock split.

text.p: California Water Service Co on Wednesday said it plans a two-for-one stock split in conjunction with a change in structure to a holding company.
In addition, the company said it raised its annual dividend to $2.11 a share from $2.08. The first quarterly dividend payment will be made on February 15 to shareholders of record on February 3.
Under the stock split plan, each share of California Water Service will be converted into two shares of the new holding company, which will be named California Water Service Group.
California Water's shareholders will vote on the new structure and stock split at an annual meeting in April, the company said.

Under the holding company structure, the company's non-regulated business will be operated by a new subsidiary called CWS Utility Services, and its regulated business will continue to be operated by California Water Service Co.
